envDistribution 0.0.0.9000
  • Reference
  • Changelog

Return relevant taxa to a region of interest based on occurrences and or distributions.

Source: R/reg_taxa.R
reg_taxa.Rd

Useful for species level analyses seeking to link to relevant trinomials (subspecies, races, varieties, forms, etc), where there may be other irrelevant trinomials occurring outside the region of interest.

reg_taxa(
  bio_df,
  out_dir,
  region_bound,
  force_new = FALSE,
  pres_x = "long",
  pres_y = "lat",
  in_crs = 4326,
  out_crs = in_crs,
  buf = 0,
  taxonomy = targets::tar_read(taxonomy, store = fs::path("H:/dev/out/envCleaned",
    "sa_br_dissolve______0__P50Y__sa_br_dissolve", "90__90__P1Y__subspecies", "clean")),
  listed_df = arrow::read_parquet(fs::path("H:", "data", "taxonomy",
    "all_status_galah.parquet")),
  taxa_ds = dists_source(distrib_dir = data_dir, sources = c("epbc", "expert"),
    source_rank = FALSE, datatype = "vector")
)

Arguments

bio_df

Data frame with taxa column, and lat & long columns.

out_dir

Character. Directory path for the results files to be saved (summary_stats.rds and mcp_noreg.parquet). mcp_noreg will be saved by sfarrow::st_write_parquet(). Currently will not work very well with any full stop in the path. Other file types are changed to .parquet.

region_bound

sf object. Region boundary polygon.

force_new

Logical. If any of the results files in the out_dir exists, recreate it?

pres_x, pres_y

Character. Name of the columns in presence that have the x and y coordinates.

in_crs

epsg code for coordinates in presence.

out_crs

epsg code for coordinates in output grid.

buf

Distance in metres to buffer the region_bound.

taxonomy

Taxonomy object returned by envClean::make_taxonomy in relation to the taxa in bio_df and taxa_ds.

taxa_col

Character. Taxa column in bio_df and taxa_ds (must be the same).

Value

summary_stats.rds with aoo and eoo stats, and mcp_noreg.parquet with the mcp excluding regional presences.

Contents
